;

;The car stopped at the location where the name of the village was marked on the electronic map, with mountains on one side and cliffs on the other.

;

;The driver carefully turned around, turned in through the overlooked gap, and drove through three turns on the newly found path and around two mountains. The ravine between them reaches the other side of the mountain. This is the destination - a remote village within the jurisdiction of Jingning County, Pingliang City, Gansu Province, where the electronic map failed to include the correct location.

;

;Looking from a distance, this village almost looks like it grows on an earth-yellow hillside, with buildings with red roofs and white walls stacked on top of each other around the mountainside. On November 16, 2023, the village was sparsely populated. The snow has melted, and an older couple is working in the fields, planning to hoe the soil to grow potatoes. The apples that the locals are proud of have been picked and sold, and the village is about to enter a slack period.

;

;Nine days ago, a person close to the village was executed. His name is Zhang Longji, born in Jingning County in 1979, with a university education. According to the announcement of the Pingliang Intermediate Court, from 2010 to June 2019, when he served as the teaching director, principal and teacher of a primary school in Jingning County, he used corporal punishment and other means to form a mental coercion on primary school students who lacked sexual defense ability. He used explanation exercises, When students handed in homework and other opportunities, they repeatedly raped 5 young girls aged 8 to 12 years old in their dormitories, and repeatedly raped 17 girls aged 8 to 14 years old in public in the classroom or in their dormitories. Child molestation.

;

;Perhaps to protect the privacy of the victim, the court did not disclose the name of the elementary school where Zhang Longji taught. Southern Weekend reporters learned that the primary school where the incident occurred was a village primary school in the aforementioned village and had been withdrawn in 2019.

;

;When the news that "a primary school principal raped and molested 22 girls in 9 years" caused an uproar on the Internet, this village in the eye of the storm seemed particularly silent.

;

;A small village in the mountains

;

;"Especially in our village, don't ask about these things." Upon hearing Zhang Longji's name, villager Zhang Bi Peng's tone became stern. On November 16, 2023, he stood at the gate of the hospital and waved his hand to drive away Southern Weekend reporters, saying, "It's all my sad past."

;

;Zhang Bipeng’s yard is only a few hundred meters away from the original site of the primary school where the incident occurred. Only the couple lives at home, and his father, Zhang Pinghe, takes care of his grandson in Jingning County.

;

;Zhang Pinghe is the old principal of the primary school where the incident occurred. He has taught in the village for more than 40 years and has now retired. On social platforms, he is called "Perseverance in the Mountains."

;

;Today, the empty and abandoned school building remains at the north end of the village. The gate is locked from the outside and cannot be entered. The outside of the courtyard is filled with corn stalks as high as the wall. Compared with the picture that appeared in the news ten years ago, the red roof of the elementary school bungalow still looks the same, and the exterior wall has turned white, as if it had been painted and repaired in the last few years, and the windows and doors are sealed.

;

;The yard next to the school is still open. There are only two old houses. One is piled with props for celebrating the New Year and the lion dance. The other has several An old, dusty wooden table with medals hanging on the wall. Among the dead branches and weeds, there are two green basketball hoops. A villager said that this area is the school playground.

;

;The villager introduced that the primary school was merged in 2019, and then the children in the village went to the central primary school in the town to study. It was the first boarding school in the town.

;

;Before the merger, this rural primary school was once a model in Jingning County. Among more than a dozen schools in the township, it ranked among the top three in performance every year. There are not many people in the school. When Sun Chuning, a staff member of the Jingning County Education Bureau, visited in 2015, there were only 29 students and 5 teachers in the school. Many students go to towns or counties with their migrant parents.

;

;In 2015, Zhang Pinghe was still the principal, one or two years away from retirement. Sun Chuning had a good impression of the old principal, "Teacher Zhang has been taking care of the school for decades, both during winter and summer vacations." He said he did not know Zhang Longji and did not pay attention to his situation when he visited the school.

;

;The old principal has been commended repeatedly. According to public reports, he once took teachers to quarry clay to paint classrooms, went to a forest farm to collect waste materials to make simple tables and stools, and stayed at the school building to dig canals to divert water during heavy rains. Some netizens said in the comment area that in their memory, even the wife of the old principal pulled a trolley and worked in the school.

;

;A Pingliang photographer once shot a short film for the old principal when he was about to retire. He said that the photo was taken for "awards and competitions". At the end of the film, the words "Produced by Jingning County Education Bureau" appear.

;

;At the same time, Zhou Lan, a school-age student who lived in a nearby village, came to this primary school to study. The school's reputation is one of the reasons why parents choose the school, but more importantly, it is almost his "only solution" for transportation.

;

;The surrounding area is inconvenient and there is no public transportation. Students measure distance by round-trip walking time, and anything that can be reached by walking in 30 minutes is considered "very close." The map shows that Zhou Lan has to walk about 7 kilometers to the central primary school in the town, which takes an hour and a half on foot. At that time, "there was an age requirement for living in school there, and you had to be in fifth grade or fourth grade." So Zhou Lan could only attend this village primary school.

;

;The grandchildren of the old principal did not study in this village primary school, but were sent to the county town and are now studying in high school. Zhang Bipeng explained that because “the conditions in the county are good.”

;

;The number of teachers and students in rural primary schools is constantly decreasing. At its peak, the school had more than 200 students. A few years before Zhou Lan enrolled, there were more than 100 people in the school. “There were quite a lot of people at that time, but they all left in the end.” In a school evaluation and acceptance self-inspection report filled out by Zhang Pinghe in 2016, the school had only 21 students and 4 faculty members, divided into 4 teaching classes.

;

;The report states that the primary school was founded in 1957. It was expanded into a standardized primary school on the original site in 2002 and changed to a six-year complete primary school in 2003. The old principal wrote this paragraph in the report: The school carefully organizes teachers and students to study education laws and regulations, teachers' law, and the Law on the Protection of the Rights and Interests of Minors. All teachers and students in the school know, understand and abide by the law.

;

;Zhang Longji is one of the above-mentioned teachers. A relevant roster of Jingning County in 2014 shows that Zhang Longji was a professional technical level 12 and a primary school teacher level 2 at that time.

;

;In 2017, Zhang Longji took over as the principal of this village primary school. The transfer of teachers in rural schools is the responsibility of the local education bureau. The principal of a rural primary school in Gansu said that the position of principal must go through layers of selection before being qualified, including examinations and background training. “Each unit has to go through it again. For example, if there is a problem with your credit card, you will not be allowed to pass. , particularly strict.”

;

;According to the court notice, Zhang Longji had been committing crimes for several years at this time. Why didn’t Zhang Longji’s actions attract attention during this period? As of press time, Zhang Pinghe had not responded to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Jingning County Education Bureau stated that the relevant details involve the protection of minors, so it is inconvenient to disclose them.

;

;“I didn’t understand it at that time, so I saw it as a joke”

;

;When Zhou Lan was studying in this village primary school, he saw Zhang Longji with his own eyes He molested students in the classroom, but felt he had no choice but to do anything about it because "he is the principal."

;

;After the school was annexed and the school building was locked, Zhou Lan and several male classmates secretly climbed over the wall and entered. He said that Zhang Longji had two dormitories at the school, one of which belonged to his wife. The couple has two girls and one boy, and their three children sometimes come to live in the dormitory.

;

;Zhou Lan said that he and his classmates tore off the seal on the dormitory door and held a "special ceremony" inside. According to the video sent by Zhou Lan, they placed a photo on a low table, placed three small trays in front of the photo, placed chocolate pie on it, and burned paper on the side. Before Zhang Longji's execution, this "ceremony" with the meaning of memorial was a kind of revenge. They have been held three times in total, the last time in October 2023.

;

;Zhou Lan hated this teacher in her heart. He said that Zhang Longji often corporally punished and beat students, and he was very cruel. "He took a stick and hit me on the head, (beating) to death, which cast a shadow on me."

;

;They are the last batch of students Zhang Longji taught and are now in junior high school. Zhou Lan recalled that before the incident in 2019, there were only three girls left in the school, and some had transferred away before. Zhang Longji would molest girls in front of him. When correcting homework in class, he would also call girls to the podium and molest them in public.

;

;He also heard from girls in the school that Zhang Longji would call them to the dormitory. When school was over in the evening, Zhang Longji would use excuses such as "the homework was not finished" to prevent female students from going home and keep them until after nine o'clock in the evening. He said that he was still young at the time and had little idea of ​​what Zhang Longji did. He only thought it was strange and did not tell his parents.

;

;What Zhou Lan saw was just the tip of the iceberg. During an interview with Southern Weekend reporters, we learned that the incident of being molested by Zhang Longji was probably earlier than the time mentioned in the court notice and had occurred since his early years of teaching.

;

;From 2004 to 2005, Lulu was in the first grade of a primary school in the town, and Zhang Longji, who was about 25 years old at the time, was her math teacher. She recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that at that time the school was a bungalow and it was very cold in winter, so they used stoves to burn charcoal for heating. During math class, Zhang Longji would call a female student to the podium, hold her in his arms, and "do some very intimate gestures" in front of thirty or forty students in the class, in the name of checking her homework. She said that she had personally seen several girls in the class being hugged, and "he would pick some of the prettier little girls."

;

;Lulu herself is also a victim. Zhang Longji held her in his arms and breathed into her, "I felt very strange, so I hid."

;

;By 2009, Professor Zhang Longji’s subject changed from mathematics to English. That year, Zhang Lei, a male student, was in the third grade. During class, Zhang Longji held the girl in his arms and taught her vocabulary, touched her face, and behaved affectionately. He saw a female classmate sitting on Zhang Longji's lap with a look of disgust on her face. Forced by the teacher's authority, she did not dare to make any big moves to resist. She could only twist her body to avoid his physical contact, but it did not have much effect. "I didn't understand it at that time, so I just took it as a joke."

;

;In the same year, during a break in class, fifth-grade Lin Ling said that she was lying on her back in class. When she was sleeping on the table, there were many students in the classroom, and Zhang Longji suddenly hugged her from behind. Lin Ling was frightened and quickly said, "Hurry up and let me go." He let go.

;

;According to the accounts of former students, Zhang Longji’s obscene behavior lasted for a long time, and students of different grades were victimized. "He should have been molesting girls since he first joined the workforce... My previous class, my current class, my next class, including my sister's class all know about it." November 2023 , Lin Ling told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Lin Ling said that female students did not dare to get along with Zhang Longji and were afraid of being hugged by him. They felt "especially annoying" and privately complained to each other "Why does he Here it is again”. "But we didn't even realize at the time that he was breaking the law."

;

;Ignored help

;

;The first female students Zhang Longji molested Tried to save myself. Lulu, who was 7 years old at the time, told her mother about this "strange thing". Her mother didn't take it seriously and just thought it was an elder's love for children. "She said that your math teacher thinks you are very good and feels sorry for you."

;

;During the parent-teacher conference, Zhang Longji would face Lulu’s mother Praise her and say that the little girl is "very smart and well-behaved". Lulu analyzed that this strengthened her mother's judgment and made her feel that the young mathematics teacher was very responsible and appreciated her daughter, without any warning. Looking back, Lulu feels that rural parents “are very lacking in awareness in this regard.”

;

;Lin Ling agreed with this analysis. She euphemistically said that the adults in the village are relatively simple, traditional and conservative. Lin Ling, who was 12 years old at the time, told her mother that there was a teacher in school who always hugged female classmates during class and also hugged herself, but the answer she received was unexpected. "My mother said that my thoughts were not sincere."

;

;Talking about the memory of asking her parents for help in fifth grade to no avail, the adult Lin Ling hesitated for a few seconds. ,Sighed. "Maybe he has a better personality, but the adults don't believe it." She told her mother two or three times, but when she saw her mother's reaction, she stopped mentioning it.

;

;In front of children and adults, Zhang Longji has two different faces. When facing students, he sometimes kissed and hugged them, and sometimes violently punished them. But when facing adults, in Lulu's words, he behaved politely and responsibly, "it's quite invisible." His WeChat avatar is an ID photo with a red background, a Chinese character face, single eyelids, a wide nose, a smile, wearing a black suit and a red polka dot tie, and his hair is meticulously combed.

;

;Where Zhang Longji grew up, the villagers also had a good impression of him. Compared with the remote teaching villages, Xiaohe Village in Gangou Town, where Zhang Longji's home is located, is closer to Jingning County and has convenient transportation. In the eyes of the villagers, Zhang Longji is one of the few "top students" who has gone to university, with high academic qualifications and decent work.
;

;

;A villager said that Zhang Longji and his two sisters were both college students. After graduation, they earned money and renovated old houses in the village. A building was bought in the county seat. Zhang Longji's wife is a teacher. "His wife is teaching. She is slim (dialect means thin) and her family is in good condition."

;

;Now the Zhang family's house is vacant, the iron door is rusty and locked, unused bricks are piled in the inner courtyard, and the red paper on the porch has faded. The courtyard is scattered with yellow leaves floating off the branches. The above-mentioned villagers said with some sadness that Zhang Longji's family was poor when he was a child. The shoes his mother wore were made of rags without uppers. His father sold rapeseed and raised three college students with hard work. They never thought that he would go down the wrong path.

;

;

;The last time the villagers saw Zhang Longji was in 2019. Some villagers remember that in April of that year, an old man died in the village. Zhang Longji returned to the village to "carry and bury the person." He was in "good condition" at the time, but he did not expect that the crime of rape and indecency was about to be exposed.

;

;More than a month later, Zhang Longji was taken away by the police during the Dragon Boat Festival after a victim's family called the police.

;

;Zhang Longji still has relatives who run a supermarket in Xiaohe Village. He said that Zhang Longji rarely returned to the village after settling in the county, and there was not much contact between the two parties. "After the old man (Zhang Longji's parents) disappeared, he would not come back for a year or two. When he came back, he would have a quick meeting and we would not chat."

;

;He refused to recall when he learned that Zhang Longji molested students. "These things have happened, and now everyone here knows that there is such a person. There are some things that we can't talk about in depth, can't say, and don't want to say."

;

; A 64-year-old villager still has a good impression of Zhang Longji, thinking that he is a decent person and behaves "stablely."

;

;He may have never seen Zhang Longji's ruthless side. According to the students' accounts, both boys and girls were beaten by Zhang Longji, and iron rods, steel bars, and mops were all "weapons." A boy recalled that when he was in the third grade when he was 9 years old, he was beaten so hard that he "couldn't sit still for a month, and his buttocks were all black."

;

;Violence makes seeking help more difficult. Lin Ling remembers that when he was in first grade, Zhang Longji kicked a boy from the front of the podium to the back of the classroom. "No one dared to resist, really. Because he beat people so fiercely, we didn't dare to say anything."

;

;"I never mentioned the past injuries again"

; < p style="text-align: left;">;The most difficult time for Lin Ling to let go was watching her friend being hurt by Zhang Longji. One day when she was in the fourth or fifth grade, during extracurricular activities, she and her friends went to Zhang Longji's dormitory to hand in homework. Zhang just came back from playing ball and was naked in the dormitory, wearing only shorts. "When we handed in our homework, he hugged my classmate and kissed him hard there. It scared me. I ran away quickly."

;

;There were no other teachers around at that time. Lin Ling ran out and told another classmate what happened. The two comforted each other and said, "It should be fine." About 10 minutes later, the classmate who was hugged came out of Zhang Longji's dormitory. Lin Ling asked about her situation, and the reply she received was "nothing."

;

;"I was very worried about that classmate of mine, but when we were young, we didn't dare to say anything." Lin Ling recalled.

;

;That memory became the shadow of her childhood. She always remembered that the female classmate who was being hugged was trying hard to resist and try to break free, but she was only a primary school student, thin and not very strong. Zhang Longji kept holding her and kissed her on the mouth. It was only after Lin Ling grew up that she realized, "Every time we hand in homework or do anything else, we have to go to his separate dormitory."

;

;Things are buried deep in the hearts of the two girls. "I know (that incident did) a lot of harm to my classmate, but until now I haven't dared to ask her. She is now married, and the matter has never been mentioned again."

;

;For twenty years, most of the victims licked their wounds silently. After the news that "a primary school principal raped and molested 22 girls in 9 years" attracted attention, some people worried on social platforms: What will happen to the children who have been harmed? They still have a long way to go.

;

;Sun Xuemei, the initiator of "Girls Protection" and deputy editor-in-chief of ifeng.com, told Southern Weekend reporters that after being sexually assaulted, children's psychology will change, even in the long term. Troubled, I hope that with the help of the local Women's Federation and other departments, the children can receive timely psychological intervention.

;

;She specifically reminded parents not to beat, scold or blame their children. "This is not the child's fault. We need to make the child feel that the family is safe and that parents can accept talking and relying on them. If after such an incident, parents beat, scold and blame them, they will push the child into a more helpless situation. ."

;

;The "Girls Protection" project team has been to many rural schools across the country to conduct sexual assault prevention courses. Sun Xuemei found that the common problem currently is the lack of sex education, and many people talk about sexual perversion. However, it can be seen from the gradually increasing reporting rate that people's awareness is improving. "Only when everyone's awareness increases and they pay attention to this problem, and (the problem) is exposed more and more, will it be solved faster."

;

;The end of Zhang Longji’s criminal behavior was due to the call to the police by the victim’s family in June 2019.

;

;Zhou Lan recalled that at noon on the day of the incident, Zhang Longji drove away from school. Also disappearing was a female classmate from the school. “After class, (I) saw that the girl was not there, so I told other teachers. I didn’t know that until the next day.”

;

;He heard from the girl’s sister that the girl tried her best to resist and was beaten with a heavy object by Zhang Longji and was seriously injured. The girl was sent to Jingning County Hospital, but her injuries were serious and she was sent to Lanzhou for medical treatment. Zhang Longji was later taken away by the police in Lanzhou.

;

;In November 2019, 30-year-old Yu Tong met Zhang Longji in the detention center, and the two stayed in the same cell for three months. After completing his sentence in 2023, he provided his release certificate to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In the prison cell, Zhang Longji wore a red vest, handcuffs and shackles. Yu Tong said that "inmates" all knew that he was suspected of rape and child molestation. During that period, Zhang Longji was often bullied by his fellow prisoners and had to be moved from one cell to another. Another "inmate" Zhao Wuping also confirmed that "people like him are often bullied in there."

;

;Zhao Wuping entered the detention center for drunk driving in July 2019. He was "headache" about his situation and did not want to chat with other people. But he remembered that Zhang Longji's condition at the time was "not bad" and he said, "He will be released after being sentenced to more than ten years."

;

;The seriousness of the matter obviously exceeded Zhang Longji's expectations.

;

;Pingliang Intermediate Court sentenced Zhang Longji to death for rape and deprivation of political rights for life; for child molestation, he was sentenced to ten years in prison; several crimes were punished concurrently. ,Decided to implement the death penalty, deprivation of political rights for life. Zhang Longji once appealed, but the appeal was rejected by the Gansu Provincial High Court and the original death sentence was upheld, which was approved by the Supreme People's Court.

;

;On November 7, 2023, the Pingliang Intermediate People’s Court followed the execution order issued by the President of the Supreme People’s Court, verified Zhang Longji’s identity, and escorted him to the execution ground. Execution by lethal injection.

;Recently, some parents posted online that on November 23, 2023, Changtu County, Tieling City, Liaoning Province The Experimental Primary School transferred a student from Class 11, Grade 4, to Class 8 without communicating with the parent committee. The article stated that the student threatened the entire class when handing out mid-term exam papers, hugged the teacher's lap and cried and made a fuss. He also knelt down and prayed to the teacher not to tell his parents about the test results. After being rejected, he threatened and insulted the teacher, causing the head teacher to be hospitalized due to sudden illness. .

;

;Parents protested collectively and picked up their children early to start a class strike. On November 29, the local education bureau issued a notice saying that the primary school was transferring a student to a parallel class. Parents of the students who were transferred to the class showed resistance, and many students did not attend school. They reported the matter online. Changtu County Education Bureau and Experimental Primary School... decided after research to cancel the class adjustment plan.

;

;What do you think of this incident? First, it is necessary to explore the nature of the student's problem. If what the above parents said is true, then from the fact that the student threatens the whole class, begs the teacher, and threatens and insults the teacher, it seems that the student may have behavioral problems, but the specific problem is still difficult to determine.

;

;However, it is not difficult to understand the position of the parents of Class 8: originally the class order and discipline were good, but suddenly a "troublemaker" and "trouble maker" came, making other children uneasy and affecting their learning. No one will welcome it, cause tensions, or even upset children's moods. If you can't turn them away before you come, it will be difficult to ask them to leave after they come.

;

;Because a student in a class has behavioral problems or character problems, disrupts classroom order or bullies other students; or parents are over-protective of their children and have serious conflicts with other children and their parents. , As a result, other parents can't bear it anymore, and they "go on strike" in anger, go to the Education Bureau to petition, and complain online. This often happens.

;

;In 2019, parents of fifth graders at Hangzhou Wenlan Experimental School published an open letter online saying that a student named W was an overprotected child by his parents. If he had any disputes with teachers or classmates at school, his parents would directly They stormed schools and classrooms, and repeatedly threatened and abused the children, parents, and even teachers in extreme ways. For this reason, parents went on strike in anger. A situation report issued by the school stated that "an incident occurred in Class 505 of our school where many students asked for leave but did not come to school to study."

;

;Secondly, the way the school and the local education bureau handle such incidents is nothing more than trying their best to mediate and persuade.

;

;Changtu County Experimental Primary School gave up its plan to adjust classes, saying it "will further optimize educational resources, rationally allocate teachers, and teach students in accordance with their aptitude." The implication is that the students with the problem will continue to remain in Class 11, but it seems that they will be replaced by teachers who are more resistant and more capable to tackle the problem. "Currently, students have fully returned to school," and the problem has been temporarily resolved.

;

;In the case of the strike at Hangzhou Wenlan Experimental School, a joint special class composed of the District Education Bureau and the District Public Security Bureau was established, and then a parent interview meeting was held to "carefully listen to the parents' feedback and demands." “Both parties actively communicated to eliminate differences, and after discussions, a preliminary consensus was reached.” Students who asked for leave “returned to school one after another” that afternoon.

;

;Why are similar solutions so common? This is because the current Compulsory Education Law stipulates that students who violate the school management system shall be criticized and educated by the school and shall not be expelled (Article 27). Under such constraints, if there are "problem children" in a class who are considered unbearable by many parents, they can only tolerate it at the beginning. If they can't bear it anymore, they will use strikes, petitions, and open letters online to try to overcome the pressure of public opinion. Let the "problem children" transfer to another school; if they really can't be driven away, well-connected parents will consider transferring their children to another school.

;

;Of course, there are many people on the Internet who say, and their voices are quite loud: Isn’t it enough to transfer “problem children” to vocational schools for correction? This simplifies the problem.

;

;Indeed, Article 6 of the Law on the Prevention of Juvenile Delinquency stipulates: The state shall strengthen the construction of specialized schools and provide specialized education to minors with serious bad behaviors. So, what constitutes serious bad behavior?

;

;The bad behavior defined in this law refers to "behavior carried out by minors that is not conducive to their healthy growth", such as truancy and truancy for many times; associating with people with bad habits in society, organizing or Joining a gang that commits bad behavior, etc. Obviously, it is fine if bad behavior only harms oneself. The key is that many bad behaviors have negative externalities and will harm other children.

;

;Article 31 of the Law stipulates: Schools shall strengthen management and education for underage students who have bad behaviors and shall not discriminate; for those who refuse to correct or the circumstances are serious, the school may punish them according to the circumstances or take the following measures: Management education measures: provide discipline; require compliance with specific codes of conduct; require participation in specific special education; require participation in on-campus service activities; require psychological counseling and behavioral intervention from social workers or other professionals, etc. But obviously not including expulsion.

;

;The so-called serious bad behavior refers to "behavior committed by minors that is stipulated in the criminal law and not subject to criminal punishment because they are under the legal age of criminal responsibility, as well as behavior that seriously endangers society", such as fighting in groups, chasing , intercepting others, forcibly taking or arbitrarily damaging or occupying public or private property and other provocative and troublemaking behaviors; beating, insulting, threatening, or intentionally injuring others' bodies, etc. So can someone with this kind of behavior be immediately sent to a vocational school? Neither.

;

;Article 41 of the Law stipulates: For minors who have serious bad behavior, the public security organs may take the following corrective and educational measures according to the specific circumstances: admonish them; order them to apologize and compensate for losses; order them to declare repentance. ; Ordered to regularly report on activities; ordered to abide by specific behavioral norms and not to perform specific behaviors, contact specific people, or enter specific places; ordered to receive psychological counseling and behavioral modification; ordered to participate in social service activities, etc.

;

;If a minor commits an act that seriously endangers society, the circumstances are egregious or causes serious consequences, or if a minor commits an act that seriously endangers society multiple times, or refuses to accept or cooperate with the corrective education measures stipulated in Article 41 above, Upon evaluation and approval by the Specialized Education Steering Committee, the education administrative department together with the public security organs may decide to send the student to a specialized school to receive specialized education.

;

;It can be seen that students only disrupt classroom discipline and bully other students, which is not considered "serious bad behavior". It is impossible to be expelled and it is impossible to go to a vocational school. However, this type of behavior is enough to cause great consequences. Externalities make other children and even teachers and parents miserable. Within the above framework, the problem is difficult to solve, and I am afraid it will still happen from time to time in the future.

;In the second half of 2023, as the A-share volatility intensified, approaching 3,000 points several times, "quantitative trading" became The focus of controversy in China’s capital market. The market has set off rounds of discussions around whether quantitative funds are "tools for cutting leeks and vampires of the stock market."

;

;But the leading quantitative funds, which have always been low-key, continue to make news. At the end of August, according to reports from multiple media outlets including Securities Times and Brokerage China, Qiu Huiming, founder of Minghong Investment, purchased Shanghai’s “first luxury home” for 285 million yuan. At the end of October, news of an extramarital affair among the founders of another leading quantitative company, Magic Square, spread widely in the asset management circle.

;

;A private equity firm chairman told a Southern Weekend reporter: "The biggest problem with quantitative funds is that no one has publicly disclosed specific operating methods."

;

;Mysterious quantitative investment How exactly does it work? Why does quantitative investing become the target of public criticism during a stock market downturn?

;

;Southern Weekend reporters recently interviewed a large number of domestic quantitative investors. What's interesting is that they are eager to explain to the outside world what quantification is, but they also want to hide behind the scenes - "Low-key, we must be low-key."

;

;;Simons’ followers;

;

;In 2010, the American high-speed network provider Spread Networks spent US$300 million to build a long-distance network between Chicago and New York. The straightest optical cable of 1,330 kilometers only shortens the time for high-frequency traders to obtain information by 0.003 seconds. Michael Lewis tells this true story in his book "High Frequency Traders: Wall Street's Speed ​​Game."

;

;In this year, China's CSI 300 stock index futures were officially launched, providing a hedging tool for domestic quantitative investment. Many Chinese returned to China from Wall Street to start their own businesses. 2010 is therefore recognized as the first year of quantification in China.

;

;To date, a leading quantitative private equity fund executive has provided data to Southern Weekend reporters: Domestic funds plus overseas funds such as Shanghai-Hong Kong Stock Connect and QFII currently account for the total turnover of quantitative transactions in the A-share market. The proportion is 25%-30%.

;

;James Simons, the "Father of Quantitative Investment", is the spiritual mentor of this group of practitioners. Most of the interviewees mentioned the book "The Man Who Conquered the Market". This book records the story of how Simons successfully transformed mathematical algorithms and computer trading software into "stock market gold mining".

;

;The book mentions that the origin of quantitative investment can be traced back to the late 1980s. Before this, no one believed that computers could invest like humans, but Simons and the quantitative investors behind him firmly believed: "There must be a way to model prices." They do not believe that the market is a "random walk" that is unpredictable. Although there is a certain degree of randomness, if a certain probability distribution is used, future price trends can be predicted.

;

;Among James Simmons’ followers, there are more Chinese than most people imagine. A high-frequency trader who returned to China in 2015 still can’t figure out why there are so many Chinese doing quantitative work in the United States.

;

;“Chinese account for at least one-third, and they are all over the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq institutions, either doing IT or data models.” He told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;However, Sam, the founder of a leading quantitative agency in China, thinks this is easy to understand, "The Chinese do not have outstanding advantages in other aspects. Investment banks are also very good, but do you know anyone?"

; p>;

;After Dr. Sam graduated, he became a high-frequency trader on Wall Street. He tried to test programmed trading in the domestic market around 2006, "But at that time, it took 15 seconds for domestic market data to get to me, and it took 15 seconds to send an order to the exchange. The 30-second round trip speed made it impossible to make money with real orders. ". Sam told Southern Weekend reporters that the round trip should not exceed 3 seconds at most, and the delay will bring about price changes.

;

;In June 2013, the new "Securities Investment Fund Law of the People's Republic of China" was officially implemented. Private equity was allowed to register and open accounts, and could issue its own products without having to rely on brokerage channels. This year Sam returned to China.

;

;"When I returned to China, the speed could already reach within 1 second. Now the Shenzhen Exchange can do it in several milliseconds. However, in the US market, everyone is pursuing microseconds (one millisecond is equal to 1,000 microseconds). "He said.

;

;At this stage, some senior figures from top overseas quantitative institutions began to return to China to start their own businesses, including Ren Sihong of Technetium Capital, Wang Chen of Jiukun Investment, Xu Xiaobo of Ruitian Investment, Qiu Huiming of Mingtun Investment, Yin. Xu Shunan from Nuo Assets and others.

;

;In 2014, Cai Meijie, vice president of the sales and trading department of CICC, founded Lingjun Investment; in 2015, three students from the Department of Computer Science at Zhejiang University, including Xu Jin, switched from the IT field to quantitative investment and created Magic Square Quantify. Huanfang, Minghong, Jiukun, and Ling are all known as the "Four Kings" of quantification, with each asset management scale exceeding 60 billion yuan.

;

;In 2015, China’s quantitative private equity market mainly focused on hedging products. Stock index futures were restricted in the second half of 2015, and the overall scale of quantitative private equity declined instead of increasing in the following three years. In 2021, quantification as a whole will enter a period of rapid development.

;

;"2021 is the most lively year. The entire market has turned to small-cap stocks. The market found that bulls can no longer sell subjectively. Looking back, the quantitative excess returns were done very well. At that time The scale of the industry has basically doubled," a quantitative practitioner told a reporter from Southern Weekend.

;

;At this stage, Mingtun Investment and Huanfang Investment once expanded their management scale to 100 billion levels.

;

;;"Where are the talents? ;;, ;;Where are we";

;

;Around Zhongguancun and Wudaokou area , China’s “Four Big Kings of Quantification” Huanfang, Jiukun, Lingjun, Minghong, etc. all have offices. They are close to Tsinghua Science and Technology Park, Zhongguancun Entrepreneurship Street and other places.

;

;The location is selected because "where the talents are, we are." These companies have gathered top students from prestigious universities around the world, including Stanford, Cambridge, and MIT. On the promotional wall of an institution, Zhejiang University in Northern Qing Dynasty was ranked in the bottom three.

;

;“There are a lot of people from the Yao class in leading quantitative companies.” A practitioner told a Southern Weekend reporter. When a quantitative investment institution was recruiting people, it was stated that "non-Tsinghua Yao class or Olympiad medal winners will not be accepted."

;

;In 2005, Yao Qizhi, a world-renowned computer scientist and founder of the world's modern cryptography foundation, founded the Tsinghua Academy Computer Science Experimental Class, which was referred to as the "Yao Class". There is a saying that "China's talents are in Tsinghua, and Tsinghua's talents are in the Yao class."

;

;The original intention of Yaoban's establishment was to select and cultivate the world's top computer geniuses. A Tsinghua University graduate described this as, “These are the most carefully selected and top-notch people in the country’s number one computer science department.”

;

;Most of these young people are born in the 1990s, both men and women. They were typing on the keyboard in the office, with four huge computer screens placed on their desks. At a glance, there are lines of code data.

;

;The general division of labor in traditional subjective funds is that analysts provide information, fund managers make decisions, and traders execute orders according to the instructions of the fund manager. "Quantitative funds no longer have the concept of traders or traders, but are called strategy developers and quantitative engineers." Wang Xiong, founder of Siyuan Quantitative, told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;The person who sets the model is the core person of the quantitative company. The model is composed of people + computing power. The development of quantitative trading strategies involves mathematical models, statistical analysis, machine learning and other technologies. Engineers write and test code, backtesting using historical data to evaluate the potential performance of the strategy.

;

;Therefore, their day's work content can be summarized in three words: "write code", "more like a coder".

;

;In February 2023, the leading quantitative company Huanfang Quantitative and Ruitian Investment went to court. The reason was that a strategist from Ruitian Investment took away the team and joined Huanfang. Due to the long-term high contact between the strategist and The core trade secret in quantitative investment - the quantitative trading strategy code, Ruitian Investment believes that the other party is suspected of trade secret infringement and unfair competition.

;

;In addition to the competition for talent, quantitative funds also compete for computing power.

;

;“The institution that holds the largest number of high-performance GPUs in China is not an artificial intelligence company, but a quantitative investment company. Huanfang is the number one.” A domestic GPU agent told a Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;The CPU that ordinary people are familiar with is responsible for reading the original data and temporarily storing the data in the memory. The GPU calculates the data, trains the model to obtain the parameters of the model, and performs inference and prediction without relying on humans. brain experience.

;

;An IT industry person told a Southern Weekend reporter: "A CPU only has dozens of physical cores, while a GPU has tens of thousands of CUDA cores." Core can be understood as a computing core, and a GPU is used to train a large computer. The model is calculated on a monthly basis. Correspondingly, if a traditional CPU is used, it is calculated on an annual basis. The training efficiency is very different, and the inference efficiency gap is also more than a hundred times.

;

;The NVIDIA A100 graphics card is a professional-grade GPU with very powerful computing power, reaching 19.5 TFLOPS (19.5 trillion floating-point operations per second).

;

;In 2019, Magic Square Quantitative established an AI company equipped with 1,100 GPUs. In 2021, Huanfang owns tens of thousands of Nvidia A100 graphics cards. The above-mentioned IT people were shocked by this number, which has exceeded the reserves of some major domestic Internet companies.

;

;Sam explained that since 2016, quantitative investment has adopted medium-low frequency Alpha plus T+0 (intraday reversal trading) as the main style. After 2018, it will be full-cycle models and deep learning models.

;

;“If you are building a deep learning model, researchers need to keep trying different parameters, structures, and features. A researcher can assign dozens of cards. Of course, you can also assign hundreds of cards. It’s all taken up, but it should be difficult for one person to think of so many ideas at the same time.”

;

;For a researcher to be able to configure dozens of cards, the above-mentioned IT industry people think this is bragging. Both graduated from Tsinghua University. He worked in a large factory to quantify models, and the configuration was one person per card.  

;

;;";;Covering nearly;;2000;; stocks;;";

;

;Few people know how quantitative investing makes money.

;

;An individual investor who purchased Magic Square quantitative products is well aware of the romantic stories of quantitative giants. But regarding quantitative investment, she admitted to Southern Weekend reporters: "I don't understand."

;

;The chairman of another private equity fund with a fund management scale of nearly 5 billion yuan invested a lot of his family assets in a leading quantitative company. His understanding of quantification is that market massacre is carried out based on the behavior patterns of hot money and retail investors, and quantification’s own self-operated strategies and transactions take precedence over asset management.

;

;Yang Delong, chief economist of Qianhai Kaiyuan Fund, used the "dog walking theory" to explain to Southern Weekend reporters. “Value investing pays more attention to the path people (fundamentals) take, but quantification mainly aims to achieve excess returns by discovering the movement patterns of dogs (stock prices).” Yang Delong said.

;

;Quantitative trading is called "Quantitative Trading" or "Quantitative Investment" overseas. Quantitative (quantitative) corresponds to discretionary (discretionary). The latter refers to relying on personal judgment and understanding of a matter. The decision-making process relies on personal judgment and has a greater degree of freedom.

;

;"Quantitative investment is an investment method based on data and with mathematical models (statistical models) as the core. It is completely based on data. We call it quantitative, while subjective investment is more qualitative." Sam Speaking to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In his view, whether it is an individual investor or an institutional investor, everyone has behavioral inertia, but the way of thinking is not necessarily completely rational, and mistakes will be made in the process.

;

;He divided quantification into two parts. The quantitative analysis of fundamentals is very similar to subjective, looking at public data such as profit growth and cash flow. But on the other hand, quantification will catch the wrong transactions in the market, that is, transactions that deviate from the reasonable prices set by the quantitative model. "After catching a wrong trade, we will buy if the price is lower than the reasonable price, and sell if the price is higher than the reasonable price."

;

;Taking Moutai as an example, subjective investment may judge that the stock will rise, but quantification will clearly indicate a Forecast: "We would say that this stock will outperform the market by 1% over the next 10 days, with an error of ±5%. This is entirely a statistical concept."

;

;"Quantification relies on various data (price volume Mainly based on data), the company's stock price shows a certain regular distribution, and this reasonable price refers to a range." A quantitative practitioner told a Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;Yang Delong believes that there is an essential difference between quantification and value investing. “Quantitation relies more on stock price fluctuations to make money, so it is called cutting leeks. They take a short-term approach and calculate based on the day. Value investments are generally held for several years.”

;

;Quantitative practitioners are not shy about this. Domestic mainstream quantitative private equity mostly uses statistical arbitrage as its core strategy. The forecast period ranges from intraday to several days, and generally does not exceed 10 days.

;

;Quantitative stock selection has no standards and characteristics, and does not set industries and fields. They do not pay attention to whether the company has new products, nor do they pay attention to what the secretary of the board of directors said. When a stock's stock price is "overbought" according to model calculations, quantification will directly trigger the selling of the stock without any human emotions or subjective judgments in the process.

;

;Many leading quantitative practitioners told Southern Weekend reporters that a mature large-scale quantitative company will conduct a market-wide scan of more than 5,000 stocks on the market, and do it whenever there is an opportunity. Liquidity You can do it if it's good, or you can do it if the liquidity is bad. The difference lies in whether you make more or less money.

;

;“Our bottom position currently covers nearly 2,000 A-share stocks.” Sam told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In comparison, 50 subjective long positions in stocks are already considered a lot. This has brought about a huge difference in turnover rates. A brokerage person told a Southern Weekend reporter: "The turnover rate of equity public funds is generally 3-5 times, up to about 10 times, which is already relatively active.";

;The data provided by quantitative practitioners to Southern Weekend reporters is that most of the current mainstream products of quantitative private equity generally have a turnover rate of 50-100 times. In addition, there are extremely small-scale niche strategies that have a turnover rate of 200 times. above. The annual turnover rate of the stock quantitative strategy is about 100 times, which is equivalent to an average holding period of about 5 days.

;

;Sam decided to return to China to start a business in 2013. One of the important reasons was, "At that time, domestic individual investors accounted for 90%, and the entire market was too speculative. I brought back the American model, and the American model Alpha can probably achieve 6%, but at that time the domestic market could achieve nearly 40%."

;

;Alpha and beta are risk quantification indicators proposed by Nobel Prize winner William Sharp in 1964.

;

;Quantitative companies rely on thousands of Alphas to find various patterns in the market. Southern Weekend reporters visited a number of domestic leading quantitative companies in mid-November. In their office areas, the "a" of Alpha was made into an icon and placed in the most eye-catching position. Alpha and Beta are also words that appear frequently among practitioners.

;

;Yang Lei is a post-90s private equity quantitative manager in Shanghai. He gave an example to a reporter from Southern Weekend: If it is a strategy to pursue Alpha, assuming that the market (take the wind all-A index as an example) has increased by 10% in a year, and a certain strategy has increased by 12%, then the Alpha (excess return) of a certain strategy relative to the market ) is 2%. If the strategy can maintain this excess level, if the market falls by 10% in the second year, the strategy will only fall by 8%, and still have an excess return of 2%. The pursuit of Alpha refers to the pursuit of outperforming the market in the long term.

;

;If you are pursuing Beta, it is a concept of multiples. For example, the market has risen by 10% this year, and a certain strategy has risen by 1.5*10%=15%. However, if the market falls by 10% in the second year, it will It will also fall by 1.5*10%=15%. It is equal to the strategy amplifying the fluctuations of the market.

;

;Can quantitative investment outperform the market? The private equity ranking network shows that as of the end of the third quarter of 2023, the average return of 537 quantitative private equity firms with performance updates was 3.36%, and more than 70% of them achieved positive returns. The average return rate of tens of billions of quantitative private equity is 5.75%, and companies with positive returns account for more than 90%.
;
;Sam told Southern Weekend reporters: "Quantitative is worse than subjective in terms of reasonable pricing in the short and medium term, but it is not as good as excellent subjective fund managers in terms of reasonable pricing in medium and long term." The advantage of subjective is in its ability to price individual stocks. In-depth analysis, this quantification is currently unattainable.
;
;Even Renaissance Technology, a company founded by James Simons, has experienced dismal performance in 2020 for its three funds after years of rapid growth. According to a Bloomberg report cited by brokerage China in February 2021, three Renaissance funds open to ordinary investors have suffered redemptions of at least US$5 billion (approximately 32.2 billion yuan) since December 1, 2020.

;

;;Quantification of disputes;

;

;On August 27, 2023, “halve the stamp duty collection, gradually tighten the pace of IPO and refinancing, and standardize the reduction of shareholdings. behavior, lowering the financing margin ratio”, four favorable policies were launched in one day. But the next day, A-shares opened up 5% and then fell back quickly, closing with only a 1% gain.

;

;Who is the culprit? Quantification has become a target. Many investors believe that the sharp opening triggers the selling of large-scale quantitative funds, which are the "biggest air force" responsible for market fluctuations.

;

;A war of words started in the circle of friends of investment tycoons. Investors who opposed quantification pushed the article "Quantitative Funds, the Main Force of Today's Slam" to over 100,000, while many founders of leading quantitative institutions reprinted another article - "Quantification is the Backbone of Big A".

;

;On September 1, 2023, the China Securities Regulatory Commission guided stock exchanges to introduce a series of measures to strengthen the supervision of programmed trading. Among them, "transactions with a maximum declaration rate of more than 300 transactions per second, or a maximum number of declarations in a single day of more than 20,000 transactions" will be monitored with emphasis. and impose additional reporting requirements on high-frequency trading.

;

;However, many quantitative practitioners interviewed said: "The standards of 300 declarations per second and 20,000 declarations a day have little impact on quantification."

;

;The highest declaration in a single day The number of transactions reaches 20,000, which can be achieved with a small account but high turnover. But if the turnover is low and the scale is large, this number can also be used. Sam gives an example: For example, a certain public fund has an account worth several billion. The turnover is not high, with only 5% unilateral and 10% bilateral per day. However, the transaction volume is 500 million per day, and the average order is about 20,000 yuan. There are more than 20,000 orders.

;

;“If we see trading opportunities at the opening, 5,000 stocks will have opportunities. Theoretically, we can issue 5,000 orders in one second. However, domestic trading desks cannot support it. It is impossible for a securities firm to have only you as a customer. At present, The maximum is 1,000 transactions," Sam told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Quantitative practitioners have repeatedly emphasized that programmed trading does not only refer to quantitative trading. Programmed trading refers to investment tools corresponding to "manual trading". Programmed automated decision-making is used to perform operations, and transactions can be completed at the same time. Thousands of assets, which manual trading cannot do. In addition to quantitative and private equity, public funds and subjective investments will also use programmed trading.

;

;A-shares experienced huge fluctuations in 2015, and the case of Easton manipulating the futures market became a sensation. The company used programmed trading software to automatically place orders in batches, buy and sell by itself, and use trading rules such as margin leverage ratios to illegally make more than 2 billion yuan in profit. The average order speed of Ishton is one order every 0.03 seconds.

;

;Sam said that stock index futures are particularly suitable for high-frequency products. Ishton was able to do it in seconds back then, and it has not changed much now. But "there are only a few people who speculate in futures, and they are very gambling. The mainstream is still stock quantification."

;

;Wang Xiong, founder of Siyuan Quantitative, told Southern Weekend reporters: "As far as stock quantification is concerned, A-share trading cannot have the so-called high-frequency pursuit of speed in foreign countries."

;

;From the perspective of trading mechanism, recognized high-frequency trading basically does not exist in China’s stock market due to the imposition of stamp duties. "Because I can't make any money, the speed advantage of a few seconds can't cover the stamp duty." Sam told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;According to him, the current shortest position holding period in China is 5 minutes to 20 minutes. Overseas, it cannot be considered high frequency. At most, it is only intraday trading. In the United States, high frequency trading basically takes a few seconds. A warehouse is only a few minutes slow.

;

;Sam still remembers that when he was a high-frequency trader on Wall Street, by constantly changing hands, he could build a position of up to 200 million US dollars with a capital of 10 million US dollars. "In China, our positions are held for an average of about 5 days. The purpose of these 5 days is not to get the order as quickly as possible, but to pursue a better excess performance."

;

;In addition, the exchange's matching Speed ​​is not supported either. "For example, when you send an order to the Shanghai Stock Exchange, it basically takes 30 milliseconds to wait for a return. In the United States, everyone is pursuing 1 microsecond, so if you have a fluctuation of 30 milliseconds ± 1 millisecond, it is meaningless to pursue that 1 microsecond. ." Sam told Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;But they are actually pursuing speed as much as possible.

;

;A founder of a quantitative institution revealed to a reporter from Southern Weekend that for some traders who have requirements for transaction speed, domestic exchanges have their own server hosting centers, such as the Shanghai Stock Exchange Waigaoqiao Shanghai Stock Exchange hosting room. , Shenzhen Stock Exchange Southern Center Shenzhentong custody computer room, Shanghai Stock Exchange Jinqiao custody computer room. Only securities and futures companies can rent custody computer room cabinets from the exchange.

;

;High-end programmatic trading teams usually purchase their own equipment or specify hardware configurations, which are purchased by securities and futures companies. With the consent of the securities and futures companies, they are placed in rented cabinets for trading.

;

;Around 2014, Hwabao Securities launched the LTS system, which was the first ultra-fast trading counter system in the industry. Since then, many securities firms have begun “rushing for ultra-fast trading”, mostly for quantitative private equity customers. , but there are threshold requirements for the amount of funds for customers.

;

; "There are no hard and fast requirements for the capital threshold of the Express Trading Desk, but we generally advertise that it is exclusive to high-net-worth customers. Each threshold is different, some are 1 million yuan, and some are 3 million yuan." One person Brokerage traders told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;A practitioner from a private equity institution told a reporter from Southern Weekend: "Nowadays, large-scale quantitative funds are mostly used for self-operation. They operate with self-operated funds and leverage, and their performance is the best in asset management." Several times." However, the self-operated scale data cannot be queried.

;

;

;Recently, there is news that Hebei “billionaire” Xie Kefeng has recovered his son Xie Qingshuai who has been trafficked for 25 years. It was widely circulated on the Internet and attracted great attention. Netizens were happy that the Xie family was finally reunited. And behind this, it is inseparable from the blessing of technological power.

;

;According to media reports, the "cross-age face comparison algorithm of relatives" developed by a technology company was indispensable for the family reunion. Xie Qingshuai was only 3 months old when he was abducted, and his family only has photos of him when he was 3 months old. More than twenty years later, it is obviously an "impossible task" to use this baby photo to find someone.

;

;What makes the impossible possible is to use related faces to compare and find suspected objects. Taking the search for Xie Qingshuai as an example, photos of his biological parents and eldest brother were used to compare with the police's population database. This comparison is of course relatively vague and may result in multiple results, but it also greatly narrows the scope of the search, making it easier for the police to conduct precise comparisons through DNA testing and other technologies. In this comparison, Qing Shuai was found among the top five suspects.

;

;The “black technology” used to find abducted children, the most familiar to the public is DNA comparison technology. This technology was first used by the police to identify criminal suspects in major criminal cases. As the cost of testing and comparison decreases, the application of DNA technology is becoming more and more widespread, and it also plays a role in the final "final decision" to determine kinship in the fight against trafficking and finding relatives.

;

;However, DNA comparison also has great limitations, that is, samples from both parties are required for comparison. Parents searching for relatives will naturally take the initiative to submit their own blood samples to the police, but it is not that easy to obtain samples from abducted children. DNA information is one of the most sensitive biological information of an individual. Without sufficient evidence to suspect, the police cannot force anyone to submit their DNA sample at will.

;

;Many of the children’s data in the police anti-trafficking DNA database were submitted to the police by people who knew they had been trafficked, hoping to find their biological parents. Other data comes from trafficked persons rescued by the police during anti-trafficking operations. For those trafficked persons who do not know they are being trafficked and have not been noticed by the police, their DNA information will not appear in the anti-trafficking database and will not be found.

;

;Currently, the police have set up more than 3,000 free blood collection points across the country and publicized them widely, hoping that more people would volunteer to provide blood samples and increase the coverage of the anti-trafficking database. But the number of people who can be included in a DNA database is always limited. In the past, a common method used by families looking for relatives was "human flesh" search. They follow any possible clues and travel all over the country to find relatives all year round, spending time, energy and money. However, the results are very unsatisfactory and very few can actually find the abducted children.

;

;The application of high-tech means such as face comparison and recognition has greatly improved the efficiency of finding relatives. As early as 2019, the police began to use the cross-age facial recognition technology developed by Tencent, and successfully found a child who had been abducted for 10 years using a photo of the abducted child when he was 3 years old. But the technology at the time wasn't precise enough. According to his father, at that time, 100 suspected persons were found for each identification. The police usually selected the top 5 for DNA review, and the probability of missing a hit was very high.

;

;With the advancement of computer vision and artificial intelligence technology, the accuracy of comparison is getting higher and higher. You can even compare the results using only photos of close relatives without having to take photos of the child himself. Because everyone has their ID card photo stored in the police database, using photos for identification greatly increases the scope of anti-trafficking comparisons, making it easier to find abducted children. The "cross-age relative face comparison algorithm" helped the police recover four abducted children in just six months, at least three of whom had been abducted for more than 20 years, which shows its ability.

;

;Advanced technology is used to fight abduction and find relatives, which is a good cause. Of course, it must be admitted that if used for evil, its destructive power will be huge. For example, a DNA paternity test may be used to forge paternity test certificates and settle the abducted children at the police station as their "biological" children. Of course, this is fraud, and it may also be said that it has little to do with technology. However, ubiquitous facial recognition is suspected of being abused on a large scale and may infringe on the privacy rights of ordinary people. Technologies such as AI face-changing may also be used in crimes.

;

;There used to be a saying on the Internet that "where there are photos, there is the truth." But with the development of PS technology, photos can no longer represent the truth. Some people use face-swapping techniques to replace the avatars in pornographic photos and use them for blackmail. And with the advancement of video face-changing technology, it is no longer true that "video has the truth". Today's AI technology can allow Trump to speak authentic Chinese, with flawless timbre and mouth shape, and it is no problem to fake other videos.

;

;Technology itself is neutral. Every black technology is a double-edged sword that can be used for good or for evil. Not only can technology itself be used for evil, but advanced technology can also be used to do evil. As soon as the high-tech cross-age face matching technology for finding relatives attracted attention, rumors of a "paid version of the relative finding app" appeared on the Internet. Families looking for relatives who are eager to find their own flesh and blood are easily deceived and defrauded of their money.

;

;Advanced technology contains huge power. How to use it, for good or evil, all depends on the thoughts of those who master the technology. Only by keeping technology in the hands of "good people" as much as possible, and with good systems for incentives and prevention, can technology be used to its fullest potential.

;

;However, as costs continue to fall, these new technologies will inevitably be available to more and more people, and the possibility of abuse and misuse will become greater and greater. How to prevent advanced technology from being used for evil as much as possible is also a serious issue that must be discussed. The "Gongdou Drama" of OpenAI, which developed ChatGPT some time ago, is related to the attitude towards AI technology to a certain extent. It can be seen that this is no longer a topic of unfounded worry, but an urgent one.

;At about 4 o'clock in the morning on November 27, 2023, the 110 Command and Intelligence Center received a call from the masses claiming that a certain person in Huli District After being raped in the hotel, the Huli Public Security Bureau immediately assigned police to investigate.

;Recently, the suspected lip-syncing incident at the Mayday concert has attracted widespread public attention. The incident originated from the analysis video uploaded by the blogger "Wheatfield Farmer". He used software to analyze the 12 song videos taken by fans at the Mayday Shanghai concert on November 16. After extracting the vocal analysis, he accused Mayday of "in 12 songs. "Five of the songs are lip-syncing," and another one is "the first few lines are fake, but the rest are true."

;

;After the incident fermented, it triggered reactions from all parties. Some music bloggers said they had reported it to the China Consumers Association; the Shanghai Municipal Bureau of Culture and Tourism said it would require the organizers to cooperate with the investigation; staff of the China Performance Industry Association said they had paid attention to the matter and were "waiting for the results of the cultural law enforcement department." Mayday officials first posted on Weibo that they would broadcast the entire Paris concert live online, which was interpreted by the outside world as "to dispel doubts." On December 4, their agency also issued a "solemn statement" stating that "the tour will There is no lip-synching behavior in it."

;

;According to media reports, the audio and video materials of the Mayday Shanghai concert have been submitted to the local cultural market inspection department. The relevant departments will conduct scientific evaluation and analysis and publish the investigation results. Regardless of whether Mayday "lip-synced" this time, the old topic of "lip-syncing" has been thrown back into the public opinion field, which deserves further analysis.

;

;First of all, this incident has brought new problems to "how to define lip-synching", which requires industry research and follow-up.

;

;According to Article 31 of the "Implementing Rules of the Commercial Performance Management Regulations", lip-synching "refers to the act of actors using pre-recorded songs and music instead of live singing during the performance." In this incident, judging from the blogger's accusation, Mayday's suspected lip-synching was not the simple and crude "pre-recording" in the past, but the method of "back-up singing": importing instrumental music and music into the concert project file in advance. For the vocal track, "the lower part of the verse is really sung, and the chorus is sung in the background."

;

;If "undersinging" is true, then the definition of "lip-syncing" will have a new question: Does "singing the main song really, singing under the chorus" count as lip-synching? In other words, what percentage of a song must be performed live for it to be considered lip-synching? Furthermore, today, when artificial intelligence has developed to the point where it is difficult to distinguish authenticity from fake, if the AI ​​training voice in the future is "promoted and applied", how should the industry define and prevent it?

;

;The "Regulations on the Administration of Commercial Performances" stipulates that "actors may not deceive the audience by lip-synching, and performance organizers shall not organize actors to lip-sync. No unit or individual may provide conditions for lip-synching." In fact, fake The turmoil caused by lip-synching did not start today. Similar incidents are common, and many singers have become the butt of jokes because of their genuine lip-synching. The reason is simple. Even without the constraints of the Commercial Performance Management Regulations, lip-syncing by entertainers will harm their social reputation. Lip-synching at a concert is unjustifiable in terms of professional ethics and legal responsibility.

;

;Since Mayday’s agency has issued a statement categorically denying lip-syncing and accusing the relevant remarks of “malicious attacks and rumors and slander”, one of the two statements must be false, and one party is destined to be suspected of violating relevant laws and regulations. This matter also deserves an authoritative investigation result.

;

;In addition, the "Regulations on the Administration of Commercial Performances" stipulates that "the performance organizer should send special personnel to supervise the performance to prevent the occurrence of lip-synching behavior." According to a staff member of the Beijing Cultural Market Law Enforcement Corps, Mayday this year Law enforcement officers were on site to supervise the six concerts in Beijing. It is worth asking whether Mayday’s suspected lip-synching was only in Shanghai this time? At the previous six concerts in Beijing, did the on-site law enforcement officers fulfill their responsibilities of "supervising the performances" to prevent lip-synching? This should all be clarified in subsequent investigations.

;

;Secondly, this incident also raises a question: how to define and protect the consumer rights of commercial performance audiences.

;

;If Mayday’s lip-synching is true, some viewers’ demands for “refund,” “compensation,” and “apology” should be supported. Of course, there are many viewers who "don't care whether they actually sing or not", and there are also many fans who regard the concert as a ticket to a meet-and-greet. After the Mayday suspected lip-synching incident, some fans also said that "just feel the atmosphere of the scene", "just seeing them is enough" and "it doesn't matter whether they lip-sync or do the real thing."

;

;There is a famous saying in the legal world: "struggle for rights." Any right needs to be asserted before it can be implemented. It is not difficult to imagine that there are people in the audience who are serious about lip-synching, and there are also people who don't care about lip-synching. There are people in the audience who have "high standards and strict requirements" for the viewing experience, and there are also people who bought tickets and came in just to have fun. In reality, "concert audiences" are not a homogeneous group, and their expectations for "quality of goods and services" are also different. However, since there are audiences claiming their rights in accordance with the law and regulations, the performers should respect their demands.

;

;In fact, there are a lot of lip-syncing in the European and American music circles. For example, in concerts later in his acting career, Michael Jackson would choose to lip-sync when singing and dancing some dance numbers due to physical reasons, but he The city will state in advance on its official website that the audiences who come for the "moonwalk" are not interested in whether they really sing or not; Pavarotti also lip-synched at the opening ceremony of the Turin Winter Olympics, but a generation of tenors can perform powerfully. He has won the admiration and respect of the world for showing up despite his illness.

;

;In the Chinese music scene, "lowering expectations" and "advance notification" are also widely used methods in the industry. For example, some singers lower the key or change the song in order to ensure the true singing effect. This is a frank admission of the voice. I can no longer really sing. In this case, it may be possible to respect the independent management rights of entertainers and require them to fulfill their obligation to inform, not to sell dogs on sheep's head, and let the market judge and consumers make their choices.

;

;In short, in the face of the controversy over Mayday’s suspected lip-syncing, the industry must define “lip-syncing” more accurately, regulate commercial performances with more detailed legislation and law enforcement, and at the same time In accordance with the Consumer Rights and Interests Protection Act, we protect consumers’ rights to know the truth, make independent choices and fair transactions, and respect the legitimate rights and interests of consumers who come forward to question.
